Description: Fragment from shoulder of pottery krater, with part of handle flanked by rotelles. Pale yellowish slip on outside; decoration in dark brown glaze: between handle roots, triangle divided into three sections with dots in centre. Rosette decoration on side of rotelle; horizontal dashes on side of handle.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Number "92" penciled in blue on curved portion.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.015)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4733 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
